Kids can make it, but never hold it\nor see it.
A loud sound that is unpleasant or\ncauses disturbance.
Noise
Where does Thursday come after Friday?
A book filled with definitions of\nwords, arranged alphabetically.
Dictionary
What has a neck but no body?
A container used to store\nwater or other liquids in.
Bottle
What breaks when you say its name?
It is the complete absence of sound.
Silence
If you throw a blue stone into the\nRed Sea, what will it become?
A synonym of \'drenched\'.
Wet
Who has married many women but\nwas never married?
Someone who works in the church.
Priest
What type of cheese is made backward?
Spell the word \'made\' backwards.
Edam
I fly all day but stay in the same spot.
This item is what represents a country.\nEvery country has this.
Flag
What can you catch but not throw?
A sickness whose symptoms can be\nsneezing, a runny nose, or coughing.
A cold
Everyone has it and no one can lose it.
You can see it when the sun\nshines at you.
Shadow
I have holes yet I can hold water.
What you use to scrub dishes.
Sponge
I make two people out of one.
You can look into this when\nfixing up make-up.
Mirror
You answer me, although I never\nask you questions.
One of Alexander Graham Bellâ€™s\nmost famous inventions\nfor communicating.
Telephone
I am what you are currently solving.
What type of questions are in this app?
Riddle
What is often returned, but\nnever borrowed?
A six-letter word you tell someone\nafter they give you a gift.
Thanks
What is full all day and empty at night?
What do you wear on your feet?
Shoes
What always ends everything?
Look at the last letter of \'everything\'.
G
What didn\'t Adam and Eve have that\neveryone else has?
What is a mother and a father\ncalled together?
Parents
Poor people have it. Rich people need it.\nIf you eat it, you die.
The opposite of something.
Nothing
What does a cat have that no\nother animal has?
What do you call baby cats?
Kittens
